newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: EU expresses concern over Belarus.
newsitem.headline: EU expresses concern over Belarus.

text.p: The European Union expressed concern on Friday at the political situation in Belarus and said it would like to see the republic play a full part in Europe.

A statement, issued by current EU president Ireland, said the EU was ready to assist Belarus in its development as a democratic country, subject to the rule of law and to internationally accepted constitutional principles.
It urged all parties to reach a solution which fully respected the prerogative of parliament and the Constitutional Court.

The United States called on Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko on Thursday to begin talks immediately with parliamentary leaders to resolve their dispute over a proposed constitution for the former Soviet republic.

The speaker of the parliament, Semyon Sharetsky, has accused Lukashenko of attempting to set up a dictatorship with a secretly-drafted constitution that would increase his power. The document is due to be put to a referendum on November 7.
